IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Trinity Bible College is a biblically based institution of higher education.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Trinity Bible College is a biblically based institution of higher education providing a Christ-centered Pentecostal environment for academic and spiritual preparation of men and women for ministry in church vocations and for service in other professions.
IRS990.Description: TRINITY BIBLE COLLEGE IS A RELIGIOUS INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION SERVING APPROXIMATELY 290 STUDENTS. INSTRUCTION AND ACADEMIC SUPPORT IS ONE AREA OF ACHIEVEMENT.

Activity2.Description: A SECOND AREA OF ACHIEVEMENT IS THE PROVISION OF ON-CAMPUS AUXILIARY SERVICES INCLUDING RESIDENCE HALLS, OTHER CAMPUS HOUSING, A CAFETERIA AND A BOOKSTORE.

Activity3.Description: A THIRD AREA OF ACHIEVEMENT IS THE SERVICE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IN SUPPORT OF THEIR SCHOLASTIC, SOCIAL, AND SPIRITUAL GROWTH WHILE ATTENDING COLLEGE. THIS SUPPORT RANGES FROM ENROLLMENT AND FINANCIAL-AID SERVICES TO STUDENT-LIFE SERVICES, TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, MAIL SERVICES AND SPORTS SERVICES.

OtherLiabilities.Description: PAYMENTS DUE UNDER SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Trinity Bible College chartered clubs, student academic associations, and approved faculty and staff associations have established agency accounts.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The College's endowment consists of approximately 12 individual funds established for a variety of purposes. As required by generally accepted accounting principles, net assets associated with endowment funds are classified and reported based on the existence of donor-imposed restrictions. Accumulations to the permanent endowment are added to the fund. The remaining portion of the endowment fund that is not classified as permanently restricted net assets are appropriated for expenditure by the College.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: On June 1, 2009, the College adopted the provisions of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification Topic ASC 740-10 (previously Financial Interpretation No. 48, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes). The implementation of this standard had no impact on the financial statements. As of both the date of adoption and as of May 31, 2010, the unrecognized tax benefit accrual was zero.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Trinity Bible College does not use broadcast media to solicit; however, all incoming students are given copies of the catalog and student handbook, both of which have statements regarding the nondiscriminatory policy regarding race, gender or disability. All students go through an orientation process, in which these documents are reviewed, and with which students are expected to become familiar. Likewise, the faculty handbook and staff handbook contain these nondiscriminatory policies, and faculty and staff members are expected to read and be familiar with these guidelines.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: TRINITY BIBLE COLLEGE STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE GOVERNMENTAL FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM, AS WELL AS STAFFORD LOANS, PELL GRANTS, ETC. THE STUDENTS CAN ALSO PARTICIPATE IN THE FEDERAL WORK STUDY PROGRAM, BASED ON THEIR ELIGIBILITY.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The majority of grants and assistance is administered according to the policies in place from the funding source. Typically, the grant money is received by the college and is applied directly to the student's account. The Federal Work-study Program does allow money to be distributed directly to the student.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: President Strom is provided housing by the college. This is part of his employment policy and is approved by the board each year. The housing allowance is reported in accordance with the proper payroll rules and regulations.

Form990ScheduleLPartIII.RelationshipWithOrganization: FAMILY RELATIONSHIP: WIFE Of Business Manager - Tim Glass

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: FAMILY RELATIONSHIP: SISTER OF BOARD MEMBER HAROLD LARSON
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: WAGES PAID: EMPLOYEE OF THE COLLEGE

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Committees Acting on Behalf of the Governing Body: There shall be an executive committee comprised of the officers of the board of regents, the president of the college, and the superintendents of the sponsoring districts and any others as approved by the board of regents. The executive committee shall have power to transact the necessary business of the board of regents between regular meetings. A full report of all such transactions shall be made to the board at the next regular meeting. The executive committee shall meet each year in the fall and spring as needed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Upon receipt of the draft 990, the Organization will provide a copy to the Board of Regents for their review and comment.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Any director, principal officer, of member of board of regents with governing board delegated powers, who has a direct or indirect financial interest, as defined below, is an interested person. After disclosure of the financial interest and all material facts, and after any discussion with the interested person, he/she shall leave the governing board or committee meeting while the determination of a conflict of interest is discussed and voted upon. The remaining board or committee members shall decide if a conflict of interest exists. An interested person may make a presentation at the governing board or committee meeting, but after the presentation, he/she shall leave the meeting during the discussion of, and the vote on, the transaction or arrangement involving the possible conflict of interest. The chairperson of the governing board or committee shall, if appropriate, appoint a disinterested person or committee to investigate alternatives to the proposed transaction or arrangement. After exercising due diligence, the governing board or committee shall determine whether the organization can obtain with reasonable efforts a more advantageous transaction or arrangement from a person or entity that would not give rise to a conflict of interest. If a more advantageous transaction or arrangement is not reasonably possible under circumstances not producing a conflict of interest, the governing board or committee shall determine by a majority vote of the disinterested directors whether the transaction or arrangement is in the organization's best interest, for its own benefit, and whether it is fair and reasonable. In conformity with the above determination it shall make its decision as to whether to enter into the transaction or arrangement. If the governing board or committee has reasonable cause to believe a member has failed to disclose actual or possible conflicts of interest, it shall inform the member of the basis for such belief and afford the member an opportunity to explain the alleged failure to disclose. If, after hearing the members response and after making further investigation as warranted by the circumstances, the governing board or committee determines the member has failed to disclose an actual or possible conflict of interest, it shall take appropriate disciplinary and corrective action.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The President's salary is determined using comparable data from similar colleges. The independent Board of Regents reviews and approves of the salary and the approval is noted in the board meeting minutes. The salary of the Business Manager is determined by the independent Executive Committee who has the ability to act on behalf of the Board of Regents. The discussion and approval is documented in the board meeting minutes.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Upon specific request by the public, these documents would be available.
